alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 12:56PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern San Joaquin, northern Stanislaus, west central Calaveras and southwestern Amador Counties through 145 PM PDT... At 1253 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorm from Stockton northeast to Lockeford. These storms are moving northeast around 15-20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch accumulating hail and heavy rain. Funnel clouds are also possible with these storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stockton, Manteca, Lathrop, Ione, Rancho Calaveras, Waterloo, Country Club, Garden Acres, Taft Mosswood, Kennedy, August, Camanche Reservoir, Wallace, Milton, Camanche Village, Farmington, French Camp, Lockeford, Linden and Morada. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Accumulating hail could bring hazardous road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Carquinez Strait and Delta; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley
